#‚Äã575 ‚Äî October 22, 2025

Read the Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

The Draft Go 1.26 Release Notes ‚Äî It‚Äôs still early days for the under-development Go 1.26, due to land in February 2026, but there‚Äôs already a draft set of release notes covering enhancements most likely committed to the release so far, including new‚Äôs support for¬†expressions.

The Go Team

The ‚Äú10x‚Äù Commandments of Highly Effective¬†Go ‚Äî John comes down from the mountain with ten Go commandments. The conceit may be cute, but these are essentially ten broad guidelines for Go developers, coupled with examples of adopting them in¬†GoLand.

John Arundel

Automate GitHub Actions Runner Updates with Claude ‚Äî Forget about managing GitHub Actions runners and get back to writing code. Learn how Depot uses Claude to automatically handle all those pesky updates and how you can get faster, more stable CI/CD without the¬†headache.

Depot sponsor

IN BRIEF:

  • üìä JetBrains (creator of GoLand) has released the results of its latest 'State of Developer Ecosystem Report' with Go at #4 in its 'Language Promise Index' and #1 in 'languages developers want to adopt next.'

  • The popular Go-powered Caddy HTTPS server project is now 11 years old and Matt Holt shares some updates on next steps for the project's long-term maintenance.

  • Writing Better Go: Lessons from 10 Code Reviews is a fantastic set of slides from a recent talk by Konrad Reiche at GoLab 2025.

The Speed of Random Number Generators ‚Äî There are several obvious options for generating random numbers in Go ‚Äì Daniel quickly compares their performance (spoiler: math/rand/v2 using PCG is the¬†winner).

Daniel Lemire

The 'Compare IP Subnets' Proposal ‚Äî As part of his Accepted! series explaining upcoming changes to Go, Anton explains how Go 1.26 will make comparing IP subnets (e.g. 10.0.0.0/8) easier.

Anton Zhiyanov

üìÑ Parsing Financial News for Automated Trading Decisions ‚Äì But always remember, folks: ‚Äútime in the market beats timing the market‚Äù ;-) Paolo Galeone

üìÑ JWT Authentication in Go with Gin ‚Äì With the end goal to work with Vonage in this case, but the principles can be used¬†elsewhere. Benjamin Aronov (Vonage)

üìÑ Durable Background Execution with Go and SQLite Dima Kotik

üìÑ Subtest Grouping in Go Redowan Delowar

üõ† Code & Tools

gotests: Automatically Generate Test Boilerplate From Code ‚Äî Automatically creates table-driven tests from your source code by analyzing function and method signatures. This week‚Äôs v1.8.0 release adds complete support for generics, meaning gotests can generate tests for generic functions and methods on generic¬†types.

Charles Weill et al.

What Shopify, Figma, and Stripe Use for Pair Programming ‚Äî Tuple is the most effective way to unblock PRs, make technical decisions, and polish or review¬†code.

Tuple sponsor

urfave/cli 3.1: A Declarative Way to Build Go CLI Apps ‚Äî The manual outlines all of the key features, but think shell auto-completion, option parsing, help text, etc.

Jeremy Saenz and Contributors

go-torch: Torch-Like Deep Learning Framework in Go ‚Äî Open-source deep learning framework built from the ground up in pure¬†Go.

Abinesh Mathivanan

go-nvtrust: NVIDIA GPU and NVSwitch Confidential Computing Attestation ‚Äî This is niche! It‚Äôs a Go version of Nvidia‚Äôs nvTrust to manage ‚ÄòConfidential Computing‚Äô attestation evidence from NVIDIA¬†GPUs.

Confident Security

  • üìà go-echarts 2.6.5 ‚Äì Charting and data visualization library that uses Apache¬†ECharts. You can see examples in the¬†docs.

  • üí¨ go-xmpp v0.2.18 ‚Äì XMPP client library. There's even a basic GUI chat app example in just 113 lines of¬†code.

  • Hugo 0.152.0 ‚Äì The popular static site generator has changed its YAML-parsing library, so take care if you use the terms 'yes', 'no', 'on', 'off' or variants of those in your YAML¬†files.

  • Lefthook 2.0 ‚Äì Fast and powerful Git hooks manager.

  • ü§ñ Gobot 2.6 ‚Äì Robotics / drones / IoT¬†framework.

üéÅ And one for fun..

superfile: Go-Powered Terminal-Based File¬†Manager ‚Äî A modern, well-styled (and theme-able) terminal based file manager app built atop Bubble Tea. GitHub¬†repo.

Yorukot

item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã574 ‚Äî October 15, 2025

Read the Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

15 Go Subtleties You May Not Already Know ‚Äî A well written roundup of lesser-known Go features or idiosyncrasies that‚Äôs worth a skim even if only a few jump out at you. Or if you already know about them all, you can feel a warm glow for the rest of the day üòÅ Topics include time.After, nil interfaces, and json‚Äôs - tag.

Harrison Cramer

Get O‚ÄôReilly Book Data Engineering Design Patterns, Courtesy of Buf ‚Äî Discover proven design patterns for building reliable, scalable data systems. This free O‚ÄôReilly ebook, courtesy of Buf, focuses on several important aspects of data engineering, including data ingestion, data quality, idempotency, and¬†more.

Buf sponsor

How Slow is Channel-Based Iteration? ‚Äî The makers of the Go-powered Dolt database run an example involving iteration using two channel-based approaches, as well as iter.Pull. Conclusion? ‚ÄúThe haters are right: using channels for iteration is¬†slow.‚Äù

Zach Musgrave

IN BRIEF:

  • Go 1.25.3 and 1.24.9 have been released. They're minor point releases which address a problem caused by an earlier security patch being overly restrictive when parsing X.509¬†certificates.

  • The creator of the popular Lodash-like Lo library has started work on Ro, an attempt to bring the ReactiveX reactive programming model to¬†Go.

  • üéß It's been a long time since we linked to it, but if you'd also like to listen to Go news, the Cup o'Go podcast is still going out every week.

Gist of Go: Atomics ‚Äî In Go, ‚Äòatomics‚Äô are low-level synchronization primitives from sync/atomic for performing lock-free, thread-safe operations on shared memory values. Sometimes, race-free concurrency without a mutex really is¬†possible.

Anton Zhiyanov

A Modern Approach to Preventing CSRF/CORF in Go ‚Äî Go 1.25 introduced a new http.CrossOriginProtection middleware that can help protect against cross-site and cross-origin forgery attacks using browser security headers instead of¬†tokens.

Alex Edwards

üí° Simon Willison reflects further on the technique covered above.

üìÑ CPU Cache-Friendly Data Structures in Go: 10x Speed with Same Algorithm ‚Äì When you need to squeeze out every bit of performance, keeping CPU caching in mind can make a big¬†difference. Serge Skoredin

üìÑ How to Get Started with GitHub Copilot CLI Andrea Griffiths (GitHub)

üìÑ Organizing Go Tests Redowan Delowar

üõ† Code & Tools

Excelize 2.10: A Pure Go Way to Work with Excel Spreadsheets ‚Äî A way to read and write XLAM / XLSM / XLSX / XLTM and XLTX files from Go. A long time library that keeps going from strength to strength. GitHub¬†repo.

QI-ANXIN GROUP

Sift: A Lightweight Terminal UI for Displaying Go Test Results ‚Äî Pipe your verbose Go testing JSON output into this tool for navigable and collapsible test output so you can focus only on what matters to your¬†situation.

Tim Tattersall

What Shopify, Tailwind, and Stripe Use for Pair Programming ‚Äî Tuple is the most effective way to unblock PRs, make technical decisions, and polish or review¬†code.

Tuple sponsor

Oto 3.4: Low-Level Cross-Platform Sound Library ‚Äî Used by the Ebitengine 2D game engine to play audio on a remarkable number of platforms from Windows, macOS and Linux to more intriguing options like the Nintendo Switch and¬†iOS.

Ebitengine

Goiaba: An Experimental Go Parser and Compiler in Rust ‚Äî An experimental/work-in-progress Go parser and WebAssembly compiler written in Rust, being written largely as a learning¬†exercise.

Raphael Amorim

  • Huh 0.8 (above) ‚Äì Charm's library for building forms and prompts on the terminal. v0.8 lets you create and maintain your own Field types.

  • üïí gocron 2.17 ‚Äì Job scheduling package for running Go functions at specified¬†intervals.

  • AWS Lambda for Go 1.50 ‚Äì Samples & tools for building on AWS¬†Lambda.

  • Go Micro 5.10 ‚Äì Popular Go microservices¬†framework.

  • Buf 1.58 ‚Äì CLI tool for working with Protocol¬†Buffers.

  • go-github 76.0 ‚Äì GitHub v3 API client¬†library.

  • Redigo 1.9.3 ‚Äì Redis/Valkey client library.

qjs: Run JavaScript in Go ‚Äî A new Cgo-free runtime option to integrate JavaScript into Go apps. Rather than bind to a native library, it uses a fork of QuickJS compiled to WebAssembly and then run under Wazero. You get ES2023 compatibility, sandboxing, zero-copy sharing of values between Go and JS, and the ability to expose Go functions to JS and vice¬†versa.

Thea Heinen (Cloudflare)

#‚Äã572 ‚Äî October 1, 2025

Read the Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Flight Recorder in Go 1.25 ‚Äî Billed as ‚Äúa powerful new tool in the Go diagnostics toolbox‚Äù, the ‚Äòflight recorder‚Äô continuously collects execution traces and buffers the past few seconds, letting you capture exactly the window of time needed to diagnose a problem after it‚Äôs already¬†happened.

Carlos Amedee and Michael Knyszek

Cloud Infrastructure: Startup to¬†Scale ‚Äî Deploy and scale apps with containers, Supabase, AWS, Terraform, and CI/CD pipelines. Go from startup speed to enterprise-grade reliability through the three phases of growth: Startup, Growth, and¬†Scale.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Accepted! Go Proposals Distilled ‚Äî A new series of blog posts covering accepted Go language proposals ‚Äî so you can get up to speed with things coming to future versions of Go without having to read the entire proposal. So far Anton has covered maphash.Hasher and new(expr).

Anton Zhiyanov

IN BRIEF:

  • The Traefik project celebrates its tenth anniversary with a look at how it's matured, grown, and become one of the best known Go-powered infrastructure tools.

  • JetBrains offers a preview of its new Islands theme coming to its IDEs, including GoLand ‚Äì you can try it now, however.

üìä¬†'We Tried Go's Experimental Green Tea Garbage Collector and It Didn't Help Performance' ‚Äî For Dolt‚Äôs use case (which is quite specific), the experimental ‚ÄòGreen Tea‚Äô garbage collector you can opt to use in Go 1.25 provided no real benefits, but your mileage may vary so it‚Äôs worth trying¬†out.

Zach Mushrave (Dolt)

Starving, Sleeping, and Yielding: Understanding Go's Scheduler ‚Äî ‚ÄúWriting concurrent programs in Go is easy, but understanding the behaviour (or, more frequently, misbehaviour) of those programs is another¬†matter.‚Äù

John Arundel

3 Critical TTL Patterns for In-Memory Caching ‚Äî Leaning on the author‚Äôs own Hot library that provides fast in-memory caching for Go¬†apps.

Samuel Berthe

‚ö° Supercharge Postgres: 2PB Scale & 1.5t Metrics/Day ‚Äî TigerData makes Postgres the fastest database for modern workloads: 2PB scale, 1.5T metrics/day, no black¬†boxes.

TigerData sponsor

üì∫ OpenCV for Go and WebAssembly with Ron Evans ‚Äì A live 90-minute session about computer vision with Ron Evans (of TinyGo and GoCV¬†fame). OpenCV Live

üìÑ The new() Function Will Take an Expression in Go¬†1.26 Chris Siebenmann

üìÑ Build a Water Simulation in Go with raylib-go Tim Little

üìÑ Register Allocation in the Go Compiler Vladimir Makarov

üìÑ Slice Tails Don't Grow Forever Ted Unangst

üõ† Code & Tools

Do 2.0: Type-Safe Dependency Injection Toolkit ‚Äî A library that provides the dependency injection design pattern and uses generics instead of reflection in order to provide a type-safe API. If you‚Äôre already a Do user, there‚Äôs a guide for upgrading from v1.x to v2.0 to follow. GitHub¬†repo.

Samuel Berthe

Failsafe: Fault Tolerance, Resilience Patterns & Policies ‚Äî A library for building fault-tolerant apps where you can wrap code in various resilience policies such as Retry, CircuitBreaker, RateLimiter, Timeout, and Fallback. Releases in recent weeks add several new features including usage tracking (to enforce fairness) and execution budgets for setting a maximum ‚Äòbudget‚Äô for retries or hedges across a¬†system.

Jonathan Halterman

üì∞¬†Classifieds

üçê Tuple - how developers at Shopify, Figma, and Stripe collaborate on code. Stop dictating and take control with¬†Tuple.

PegoMock 4.3: A Powerful Yet Simple Mocking Framework ‚Äî Brings an easy-to-read DSL to mocking. You can do stubbing and argument matching, as¬†well.

Peter G√∂tz

eBPF Web Fingerprint: Library and Server for TCP and TLS¬†Fingerprinting
Alberto Ventafridda
